Stationery Stores Football Club, the darling team of Lagos fans, is currently embarking on mass recruitment of players for the 1995 soccer season. PMSport cornered the team at the National Theatre playing ground where young and ambi- tious players aretuning themselves up for the big challenge in divi- sion two next year. NFAHappy Over Conclusion NFAHappy Over Conclusion

Acting Head of Pro.-League de- partment, Mr. Nnochiri Nwaiwu, at the weekend told PMSport that the Tracas/Bombers controver- slal match replayed last Wednesday in Benin has clearly absolved the NFA of any misun- derstanding with Pro.-League Clubs. Acting Head of Pro.-League de- partment, Mr. Nnochiri Nwaiwu, at the weekend told PMSport that the Tracas/Bombers controver- slal match replayed last Wednesday in Benin has clearly absolved the NFA of any misun- derstanding with Pro.-League Clubs.

Nwaiwu himself who was at Benin for the match which Tracas won by a lone goal, was reacting to threat of some clubs to pull out of the league next season if NFA had not taken the Nwaiwu himself who was at Benin for the match which Tracas won by a lone goal, was reacting to threat of some clubs to pull out of the league next season if NFA had not taken the

fairest decision of allowing the match to be replayed. "I thank God the league has finally ended and on a very good note too. The two teams, Tracas and Bombers, were satisfied with the outcome of the match because it was hitch-free. "We provided adequate security for the march and ensured there was no foul play as the officials for the match were not known until the commencement of the match", Nwaiwu said. fairest decision of allowing the match to be replayed. "I thank God the league has finally ended and on a very good note too. The two teams, Tracas and Bombers, were satisfied with the outcome of the match because it was hitch-free. According to the Secretary of the Nigeria Volleyball Associa- tion [NAVA], Oluwole Akoja, the prize lists for the tourney are N3,500, N3,000 and N2,500 for the first, second and third posi- tions respectively. According to the Secretary of the Nigeria Volleyball Associa- tion [NAVA], Oluwole Akoja, the prize lists for the tourney are N3,500, N3,000 and N2,500 for the first, second and third posi- tions respectively.

Meanwhile, the ban on Cote D'Ivoire has been lifted by the organisers after the Ivoriens had signed an undertaking to control their supporters and paid a fine of N3,000.
